1.name: Little Women
1.description: A group of sisters experience life's difficulties and its pleasures while growing up in nineteenth-century America.

2.name: Battleground
2.description: True tale about a squad of the 101st Airborne Division coping with being trapped by the Germans in the besieged city of Bastogne, Belgium during the Battle of the Bulge in December of 1944.

3.name: The Third Man
3.description: Pulp novelist Holly Martins travels to shadowy, postwar Vienna, only to find himself investigating the mysterious death of an old friend, Harry Lime.

4.name: Madame Bovary
4.description: A provincial doctor's wife's romantic illusions about life and social status lead her to betray her naive husband, take on lovers and run up ruinous debts.

5.name: Samson and Delilah
5.description: When strongman Samson rejects the love of the beautiful Philistine woman Delilah, she seeks vengeance that brings horrible consequences they both regret.

6.name: White Heat
6.description: A psychopathic criminal with a mother complex makes a daring break from prison and leads his old gang in a chemical plant payroll heist.

7.name: Champion
7.description: Boxer Midge Kelly rises to fame...mainly by stepping on other people.

8.name: The Hasty Heart
8.description: In the final days of WW2, in a M.A.S.H. unit in Burma, a severely wounded corporal watches in dismay as fellow soldiers pack-up to return home but a caring nurse and five remaining soldiers bring him solace.

9.name: It's a Great Feeling
9.description: A waitress at the Warner Bros. commissary is anxious to break into pictures. She thinks her big break may have arrived when two actors agree to help her.

10.name: The Red Danube
10.description: Shortly after the end of World War II, British Colonel Michael S. "Hooky" Nicobar (Walter Pidgeon) is assigned to a unit in the British Zone of Vienna. His duty is to aid the Soviet ...                See full summary »

11.name: She Wore a Yellow Ribbon
11.description: Captain Nathan Brittles, on the eve of retirement, takes out a last patrol to stop an impending massive Indian attack. Encumbered by women who must be evacuated, Brittles finds his mission imperiled.

12.name: The Heiress
12.description: A young naive woman falls for a handsome young man who her emotionally abusive father suspects is a fortune hunter.

13.name: A Letter to Three Wives
13.description: A letter is addressed to three wives from their "best friend" Addie Ross, announcing that she is running away with one of their husbands - but she does not say which one.

14.name: The Big Steal
14.description: An army lieutenant accused of robbery pursues the real thief on a frantic chase through Mexico aided by the thief's fiancee.

15.name: Whisky Galore!
15.description: Scottish islanders try to plunder 50,000 cases of whisky from a stranded ship.

16.name: Kind Hearts and Coronets
16.description: A distant poor relative of the Duke of D'Ascoyne plots to inherit the title by murdering the eight other heirs who stand ahead of him in the line of succession.

17.name: Sands of Iwo Jima
17.description: A dramatization of the World War II Battle of Iwo Jima.

18.name: Twelve O'Clock High
18.description: A hard-as-nails general takes over a bomber unit suffering from low morale and whips them into fighting shape.

19.name: The Fountainhead
19.description: An uncompromising, visionary architect struggles to maintain his integrity and individualism despite personal, professional and economic pressures to conform to popular standards.

20.name: On the Town
20.description: Three sailors on a day of shore leave in New York City look for fun and romance before their twenty-four hours are up.

21.name: All the King's Men
21.description: The rise and fall of a corrupt politician, who makes his friends richer and retains power by dint of a populist appeal.

22.name: The Gal Who Took the West
22.description: In order to gain passage to the West, a woman poses as an opera singer, and causes a feud between two cousins.

23.name: Mighty Joe Young
23.description: A young woman who has raised a giant gorilla from an infant brings him to Hollywood years later seeking her fortune in order to save her family's ranch.

24.name: Nora inu
24.description: During a sweltering summer, a rookie homicide detective tries to track down his stolen Colt pistol.

25.name: Adam's Rib
25.description: Domestic and professional tensions mount when a husband and wife work as opposing lawyers in a case involving a woman who shot her husband.

26.name: D.O.A.
26.description: Frank Bigelow, told he's been poisoned and has only a few days to live, tries to find out who killed him and why.

27.name: The Adventures of Ichabod and Mr. Toad
27.description: An animated adaptation of "The Wind in the Willows" followed by an adaptation of "The Legend of Sleepy Hollow".

28.name: Batman and Robin
28.description: The caped crusaders versus The Wizard, black-hooded mastermind.

29.name: The Blue Lagoon
29.description: In the Victorian period, two children are shipwrecked on a tropical island in the South Pacific and fall in love while growing up together.

30.name: The Rocking Horse Winner
30.description: A young boy receives a rocking horse for Christmas and soon learns that he is able to pick the winning horse at the races.

31.name: Criss Cross
31.description: An armored truck driver and his lovely ex-wife conspire with a gang to have his own truck robbed on the route.

32.name: Banshun
32.description: Noriko is twenty-seven years old and still living with her widowed father. Everybody tries to talk her into marrying, but Noriko wants to stay at home caring for her father.

33.name: Too Late for Tears
33.description: Through a fluke circumstance a ruthless woman stumbles across a suitcase filled with $60,000, and she is determined to hold onto it even if it means murder.

34.name: Impact
34.description: A unfaithful wife plots with her lover to kill her husband, but the lover is accidentally killed instead. The husband stays in hiding, and lets his wife be charged with conspiracy.

35.name: Pinky
35.description: A light-skinned black woman falls in love with a white doctor, though he is unaware of her true race.

36.name: Riso amaro
36.description: Two criminals on the run end up working in a rice field and decide to recruit other workers for their next robbery.

37.name: Under Capricorn
37.description: A young gentleman goes to Australia where he reunites with his now married childhood sweetheart, only to find out she has become an alcoholic and harbors dark secrets.

38.name: The Threat
38.description: Vicious hood 'Red' Kluger escapes from Folsom State Prison and follows through on his threats to the detective who arrested him and the D.A. who convicted him.

39.name: The Set-Up
39.description: Because aging boxer Bill Thompson always lost his past fights, his corrupt manager, without telling Thompson, takes bribes from a betting gangster, to ensure Thompson's pre-arranged dive-loss in the next match.

40.name: The Secret Garden
40.description: A girl is sent to live with her uncle on his estate when her parents die. There she discovers much intrigue, family history and secrets and personal baggage. In particular, a screaming child and...a secret garden.

41.name: I Was a Male War Bride
41.description: After marrying an American lieutenant with whom he was assigned to work in post-war Germany, a French captain attempts to find a way to accompany her back to the States under the terms of the War Bride Act.

42.name: Neptune's Daughter
42.description: A swimsuit fashion designer is determined to protect her scatterbrained sister from a South American heart-breaker, but a case of mistaken identity complicates matters.

43.name: The Great Gatsby
43.description: A Jazz Age bootlegger learns the hard way about the wages of sin.

44.name: In the Good Old Summertime
44.description: In turn-of-the century America, Andrew and Veronica are co-workers in a music shop who dislike one another during working hours but unwillingly carry on an anonymous romance through the mail.

45.name: Act of Violence
45.description: An embittered, vengeful POW stalks his former commanding officer who betrayed his men's planned escape attempt from a Nazi prison camp.

46.name: Jour de fête
46.description: Once a year the fair comes for one day to the little town 'Sainte-Severe-sur-Indre'. All inhabitants are scoffing at Francois, the postman, what he seems not to recognize. The rising of the...                See full summary »

47.name: The Fighting Kentuckian
47.description: In 1818 Alabama, French settlers are pitted against greedy land-grabber Blake Randolph but Kentucky militiaman John Breen, who's smitten with French gal Fleurette De Marchand, comes to the settlers' aid.

48.name: The Inspector General
48.description: A town's corrupt officials think a fool is actually an investigator in disguise.

49.name: The Window
49.description: To avoid the heat of a sweltering summer night a 9-year-old Manhattan boy decides to sleep on the fire escape and witnesses a murder, but no one will believe him.

50.name: The Small Back Room
50.description: As the Germans drop explosive booby-traps on Britain in 1943, the embittered expert who'll have to disarm them fights a private battle with alcohol.
